other_tests.findings: Numerous confluent noncaseating granulomas; some active, some older with hyalinization, suggestive of sarcoidosis.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Pathological examination of both the left atrial appendage and the myectomy specimen revealed granulomatous inflammation consistent with sarcoidosis.

other_tests.findings: Asymmetric left ventricular hypertrophy with upper septal predominance (thickness of the septum, 24 mm; thickness of the posterior wall, 16 mm), systolic anterior motion of the anterior mitral-valve leaflet, left ventricular hyperkinetic with an ejection fraction of 81%. Moderate mitral-valve stenosis with severe mitral regurgitation.
other_tests.changes_over_time: After 6 weeks of glucocorticoid therapy, the thickness of the left ventricular wall was reduced (septum: 17 mm; posterior wall: 13 mm), with an intraventricular gradient of 77 mm Hg at rest.

other_tests.findings: Marked asymmetric left ventricular hypertrophy and systolic anterior motion of the mitral valve leaflet; severe mitral regurgitation and tricuspid regurgitation.
Intense heterogeneous uptake of FDG in a patchy noncoronary myocardial distribution, consistent with sarcoidosis; no significant hypermetabolic activity in the mediastinal and hilar lymph nodes.
